Text.Value: My name is Balthazar, trusted advisor of General Ketheric Thorm. Surely he spoke of me if he sent you to my aid.
What, lost for words? I've been known to have that effect on underlings. Come and join me if you survive the descent - but do not interfere.

EditorData.NodeContext: Reacting to the player's inability to respond (they've been muted)

Text.Value: Your lack of ability, perhaps? You made for an adequate errand-boy thus far, but let's not overstate your virtues.
Your lack of ability, perhaps? You made for an adequate errand-girl thus far, but let's not overstate your virtues.
Your lack of ability, perhaps? You made for an adequate errand-runner thus far, but let's not overstate your virtues.
Oh, look, he thinks he has free will. How darling.
Oh, look, she thinks she has free will. How darling.
Oh, look, they think they have free will. How darling.
I have my own reasons for seeking out the Dark Lady's domain. You play no part in them.
I'm here for my own reasons - not because of you.
You still haven't explained just who the hells you are.
Now get on with it. Try not to lose your footing. I'd hate to see good flesh wasted on a long fall into oblivion.
Your thanks buy very little - I prefer to be paid in coin. Lots of it.

EditorData.logicalname: MET B AGREED TO HELP ROGUE

Text.Value: Lead on, then.
Is this place what I think it is...?
What is this place?
I risked the ire of my goddess in helping you. I deserve more than your flaccid thanks.
I was hoping for something more substantial than 'thanks'.
How kind of you to do so exactly as I ordered you to, even after you refused. You're a better pawn than you claim to be.
Don't be so mercenary - General Thorm's approval is worth more than any mere bauble.
Quite an elaborate set-up. Is the relic truly worth it?
How did you even get here?
Simple - I followed you. It seems Shar still holds a grudge against General Thorm, and so sought to prevent me from entering in his name.
You did well - better than I would have credited you with. Now hurry along and bear witness to my masterpiece.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext:
Please restrict hip and leg movement for this line. He will be floating as he speaks.

Balthazar appears behind the player through the entrance from Shar Temple to Nightsong's prison. He's levitating and reaches their side before they can react,
EditorData.InternalNodeContext: Player met Balthazar in person and agreed to help

Text.Value: Luckily, you were the perfect agent in helping me slip past her defences. Now the Nightsong is within reach.
The Shadowfell - or at least a little pocket of it, repurposed to house the Nightsong.
You think any coin or bauble can be more valuable than General Thorm's favour? Temper your greed.
Raise one finger to me and I'd sunder you like lightning would a rotten oak. Now enough dullard questions - follow me.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Balthazar floats away, downwards towards the Nightsong enclosure

Text.Value: The Shadowfell - or at least a little pocket of it, repurposed to house the relic.
This is Lady Shar's domain. I have purpose here - you do not. Why shouldn't I just kill you?
I cleared the way to this place, not you. Why shouldn't I just kill you instead of letting you interfere?
*This creature does not belong here in the Dark Lady's sacred realm. He could ruin your chance to prove yourself to her.*
Attack.
What's stopping me from just killing you and taking this relic for myself?
I knew you would do my bidding - even though you pretended otherwise.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext:
Please restrict hip and leg movement for this line. He will be floating as he speaks.

Balthazar appears behind the player through the entrance from Shar Temple to Nightsong's prison. He's levitating and reaches their side before they can react,
EditorData.InternalNodeContext: Player met Balthazar in person and didn't agree to help
EditorData.logicalname: Didn't agree to help/Hasmet Balthazar (In person)

Text.Value: Simple - I followed you. It seems Shar bears a grudge against my master, General Thorm, and so sought to prevent me from entering in his name.
*The Shadowfell. Never before have you found yourself so close to Lady Shar's embrace. The fulfilment of her command is so close now. You must allow nothing to stop you.*
Very well, then. My sincere thanks.
Balthazar. Trusted advisor to General Thorm, and your better in every measure. Now enough questions - follow me.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Balthazar floats away, downwards towards the Nightsong enclosure

Text.Value: Who the hells are you?
I had been trying to reach this place, to retrieve something of great value. And thanks to you, the path is unblocked. Bravo.
Lady Shar... I can feel her all around. This is her domain. This is the Shadowfell.
This is the Dark Lady's domain - he does not belong here.

EditorData.NodeContext: Addressed to player re: Balthazar. Disdain.

Text.Value: Gladly. And once proceedings begin, please show some wits and do not interfere.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Balthazar floats away, downwards towards the Nightsong enclosure

Text.Value: How did you get here?
You cleared the way for me, True Soul. What promising flesh you are. As a reward, I shall let you bear witness to my masterpiece.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext:
Please restrict hip and leg movement for this line. He will be floating as he speaks.

Balthazar appears behind the player through the entrance from Shar Temple to Nightsong's prison. He's levitating and reaches their side before they can react,
EditorData.InternalNodeContext: Fallback - haven't met balthazar in person or agreed to help

Text.Value: Quite an elaborate set-up. Is the Nightsong truly worth it?
There is not a shadow of a doubt. But don't take my word for it. Come. See for yourself.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Balthazar floats away, downwards towards the Nightsong enclosure

Text.Value: What's stopping me from just killing you and taking the Nightsong for myself?

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The player is shown a vista of the Shadowfell to set up the region

Synopsis:
After the player arrives at Nightsong's prison in the Shadowfell we see Balthazar show up, hot on the player's heels. Balthazar makes his way down towards Nightsong. Variant lines for:
1. Met Balthazar in person, agreed to help
2. Met Balthazar in person, didn't agree to help 
3. Fallback (likely skipped meeting Balthazar)

If Balthazar is dead then the player is just shown a cinematic shot of the Shadowfell
